metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 北海道で猛吹雪 土日は日本海側中心に大雪 関東南部平地でも雪
all.description: 急速に発達している低気圧の影響で北海道では風と雪が強まって、見通しがまったくきかない猛吹雪になっているところがあり、気象庁は交通への影響に警戒するよう呼びかけています。7日から8日にかけては日本海側を中心に大雪となるほか太平洋側の平地でも積もるおそれがあり、最新の情報を確認するようにしてください。

all.headline: 衆議院選挙 街頭演説あすまで 党首らは接戦とみる選挙区などへ
all.description: 衆議院選挙の投票日が8日に迫り、選挙戦は最終盤を迎えます。街頭演説などができるのは7日までで、各党の党首らは、接戦とみている選挙区や比例代表での支持拡大を目指す地域に入るなど、得票の上積みを図ることにしています。

all.headline: 新START失効 トランプ大統領 “新条約策定へ取り組むべき”
all.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、ロシアとの核軍縮条約「新START」が失効したことを受け、内容を改善した新たな条約の策定に取り組むべきだという考えを示しました。

all.headline: ミラノ・コルティナ五輪 6日に開幕 開会式は4会場で選手が行進
all.description: イタリア北部で開かれるミラノ・コルティナオリンピックが6日に開幕します。「広域開催」となる今大会の開会式は、4つの会場で選手たちが行進するこれまでにない形で行われます。

all.headline: トランプ大統領 “高市首相と3月19日にホワイトハウスで会談”
all.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領はSNSへの投稿で、来月19日に高市総理大臣をホワイトハウスに招き首脳会談を行う意向を明らかにしました。

all.headline: 中国の輸出規制強化発表から1か月 経産省“今後の動向を注視”
all.description: 中国が軍民両用の品目の日本向けの輸出規制を強化すると発表してから6日で1か月です。経済産業省は今のところ目立った影響は確認できていないとしていますが、中国に対して措置の撤回を求めるとともに今後の動向を注視することにしています。

all.headline: 「モームリ」事件 紹介料は会社の口座に 支払い隠そうとしたか
all.description: 退職代行サービス「モームリ」を運営する会社の社長ら2人が依頼者を弁護士に紹介して違法に報酬を得ていた疑いで逮捕された事件で、弁護士側からの紹介料は労働組合への賛助金の名目で支払われていましたが、実際は、運営会社名義の口座に振り込まれていたことが警視庁への取材で分かりました。警視庁は、実態のない労働組合を使って紹介料の支払いを隠そうとしていた疑いがあるとみて詳しく調べています。2人はいずれも容疑を否

all.headline: Elliott raises Toyota Industries stake in push to block buyout
all.description: The U.S. fund now owns around 7.1% of Toyota Industries.

all.headline: High court orders ex-Aum leader's remains handed over to daughter
all.description: The government had said that if the remains were handed over, they would be misused by the cult's successor group and followers, harming public safety.

all.headline: Heavy snow forecast over weekend as nation set to go to polls
all.description: The coldest air mass of the season is expected to sweep over Japan, raising the risk of transportation disruptions.

all.headline: Life sentence sought for ‘Luffy’ crime ring member
all.description: The case involves Toshiya Fujita, a senior member of a crime ring behind a series of robbery and fraud cases across the country.

all.headline: ‘Michiyuki — Voices of Time’ preserves a disappearing world in black and white
all.description: With the texture of a lost era, Hiromichi Nakao’s bittersweet film resembles a docudrama about what happens to the physical world as memories and people fade.

all.headline: Mount Fuji cherry blossom festival canceled due to overtourism
all.description: The city of Fujiyoshida, Yamanashi Prefecture, said "the quiet lives of local residents are threatened."

all.headline: Japanese atomic bomb survivors fear war as U.S.-Russia pact expires
all.description: The New START treaty ended after U.S. President Donald Trump did not follow up on a Russian proposal to extend warhead limits in the agreement for one year.

all.headline: U.S. drone-makers debut at Singapore Airshow eyeing Asia sales amid China threat
all.description: The companies believe their early battlefield experience and initial Pentagon backing prove they can deliver the systems needed ‌as China builds its presence in the region.

all.headline: Rising star Aonishiki shows poise beyond years both in and out the sumo ring
all.description: Record-breaking success and incredible assimilation have both been made possible by the young Ukrainian’s diligence, maturity and strong willpower.

all.headline: Countries using internet blackouts to boost censorship, privacy firm warns
all.description: Governments in countries like Iran and Myanmar are emerging from internet shutdowns with a supercharged ability to censor internet access.

all.headline: Israeli Ambassador to Japan Speaks about Japan’s Role in the Reconstruction of Gaza
all.description: Israeli Ambassador to Japan Gilad Cohen spoke about Japan’s expected role in the reconstruction of war-ravaged Gaza, during an interview with The Japan News in Tokyo.

all.headline: Japan’s Govt Sets Goal for World’s No. 3 in Number of Highly Cited Science Papers by 2035, Up from 13th in Recent Years
all.description: The government is considering setting a target for Japan to rank third globally in the share of the top 10% most-cited papers in 2035, according to a draft of its basic plan on science and technology

all.headline: Tae Hitoto Leads Japanese Cyclists Planning Trip Around Taiwan to Express Gratitude for Post-Disaster Support
TEPCO to Reactivate Nuclear Reactor at Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Power Plant As Early As Monday
Japan’s Ginkakuji Temple to Increase Admission Fees for 1st Time in 32 Years from April
all.description: KYOTO — Admission fees to Ginkakuji temple, a World Heritage Site, will increase from April for the first time in 32 years, the temple announced last month.

all.headline: Sumo Scene / Sumo Matches Watched by Japan’s Emperor for 1st Time in 6 Years
all.description: During last month’s New Year Grand Sumo Tournament, which came to a feverish conclusion, one hot topic was the return of “tenran-zumo,” the term used when the Emperor attends the day’s matches.

all.headline: TMSC to Produce 3-Nanometer Semiconductors in Japan’s Kumamoto Pref.; Takaichi Pledges Support in Meeting with Executives
all.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) told the Japanese government on Thursday about its plan to mass-produce 3-nanometer semiconductors in Kumamoto Prefecture.

all.headline: Travel Across PokéPark KANTO, Searching Far and Wide for Your Favorite Pokémon
all.description: There are over 600 individual Pokémon at PokéPark KANTO including Psyduck grasping its head, Farfetch’d fighting with Murkrow and Litten hanging out on a roof. You gotta catch ’em all.

all.headline: Australian Woman Died of Asphyxiation in Nagano Ski Lift Accident; Victim Is Believed to Have Been Pulled Along by Backpack Chest Strap
all.description: The cause of death for the woman who became suspended from a ski lift at Tsugaike Mountain Resort in Otari, Nagano Prefecture, was hypoxic encephalopathy due to asphyxiation, prefectural police announ

all.headline: The Japan News / Weekly Edition (2/6-2/12)
all.description: Our weekly ePaper presents the most noteworthy recent topics in an exciting, readable format. View the PDF now by clicking on the following link.

Australian News Headlines | Yahoo News Australia - Yahoo News Australia
Gen Z toppled an autocrat - but old guard tipped to win Bangladesh vote
all.description: A student uprising promised a new dawn in Bangladesh but old parties are tipped to win a landmark election.

all.headline: Growing calls in India to restrict children's social media use
all.description: Some Indian states have said they are examining Australia's law curbing social media for children.

all.headline: US must be prudent when supplying arms to Taiwan, Xi tells Trump
all.description: Their call comes in the wake of a flurry of visits by Western leaders to China in recent months.

all.headline: A global craze for Korean culture is making its humblest snacks unaffordable
all.description: Black, crispy, often flat and square, dried seaweed is growing in popularity - but also in price.

all.headline: US launches plan to tackle China's critical minerals dominance
all.description: The event was attended by representatives of more than 50 countries, the White House said.

all.headline: 'Never imagined this': Indian village grapples with interfaith couple's killing
all.description: Police say they were beaten to death, allegedly by the woman's three brothers, who have been arrested.

all.headline: Rights groups say China detained two journalists over corruption report
all.description: Liu Hu and Wu Yingjiao have been reportedly detained after exposing corruption by a senior official in Sichuan.

all.headline: US and India reach trade deal, Trump says after Modi call
all.description: Tariffs will drop from 50% to 18% on Indian goods, while India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil.

all.headline: China bans hidden car door handles over safety concerns
all.description: It makes China the first country to stop the use of designs first made popular by Elon Musk's Tesla.

all.headline: Beijing criticises Dalai Lama Grammy win as 'manipulation'
all.description: The Buddhist spiritual leader is recognised in the audiobook category for his meditations.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

primary.headline: 北海道で猛吹雪 土日は日本海側中心に大雪 関東南部平地でも雪
primary.description: 急速に発達している低気圧の影響で北海道では風と雪が強まって、見通しがまったくきかない猛吹雪になっているところがあり、気象庁は交通への影響に警戒するよう呼びかけています。7日から8日にかけては日本海側を中心に大雪となるほか太平洋側の平地でも積もるおそれがあり、最新の情報を確認するようにしてください。

primary.headline: 衆議院選挙 街頭演説あすまで 党首らは接戦とみる選挙区などへ
primary.description: 衆議院選挙の投票日が8日に迫り、選挙戦は最終盤を迎えます。街頭演説などができるのは7日までで、各党の党首らは、接戦とみている選挙区や比例代表での支持拡大を目指す地域に入るなど、得票の上積みを図ることにしています。

primary.headline: 新START失効 トランプ大統領 “新条約策定へ取り組むべき”
primary.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、ロシアとの核軍縮条約「新START」が失効したことを受け、内容を改善した新たな条約の策定に取り組むべきだという考えを示しました。

primary.headline: ミラノ・コルティナ五輪 6日に開幕 開会式は4会場で選手が行進
primary.description: イタリア北部で開かれるミラノ・コルティナオリンピックが6日に開幕します。「広域開催」となる今大会の開会式は、4つの会場で選手たちが行進するこれまでにない形で行われます。

primary.headline: トランプ大統領 “高市首相と3月19日にホワイトハウスで会談”
primary.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領はSNSへの投稿で、来月19日に高市総理大臣をホワイトハウスに招き首脳会談を行う意向を明らかにしました。

primary.headline: 中国の輸出規制強化発表から1か月 経産省“今後の動向を注視”
primary.description: 中国が軍民両用の品目の日本向けの輸出規制を強化すると発表してから6日で1か月です。経済産業省は今のところ目立った影響は確認できていないとしていますが、中国に対して措置の撤回を求めるとともに今後の動向を注視することにしています。

primary.headline: 「モームリ」事件 紹介料は会社の口座に 支払い隠そうとしたか
primary.description: 退職代行サービス「モームリ」を運営する会社の社長ら2人が依頼者を弁護士に紹介して違法に報酬を得ていた疑いで逮捕された事件で、弁護士側からの紹介料は労働組合への賛助金の名目で支払われていましたが、実際は、運営会社名義の口座に振り込まれていたことが警視庁への取材で分かりました。警視庁は、実態のない労働組合を使って紹介料の支払いを隠そうとしていた疑いがあるとみて詳しく調べています。2人はいずれも容疑を否

primary.headline: Elliott raises Toyota Industries stake in push to block buyout
primary.description: The U.S. fund now owns around 7.1% of Toyota Industries.

primary.headline: High court orders ex-Aum leader's remains handed over to daughter
primary.description: The government had said that if the remains were handed over, they would be misused by the cult's successor group and followers, harming public safety.

primary.headline: Heavy snow forecast over weekend as nation set to go to polls
primary.description: The coldest air mass of the season is expected to sweep over Japan, raising the risk of transportation disruptions.

primary.headline: Life sentence sought for ‘Luffy’ crime ring member
primary.description: The case involves Toshiya Fujita, a senior member of a crime ring behind a series of robbery and fraud cases across the country.

primary.headline: ‘Michiyuki — Voices of Time’ preserves a disappearing world in black and white
primary.description: With the texture of a lost era, Hiromichi Nakao’s bittersweet film resembles a docudrama about what happens to the physical world as memories and people fade.

primary.headline: Mount Fuji cherry blossom festival canceled due to overtourism
primary.description: The city of Fujiyoshida, Yamanashi Prefecture, said "the quiet lives of local residents are threatened."

primary.headline: Japanese atomic bomb survivors fear war as U.S.-Russia pact expires
primary.description: The New START treaty ended after U.S. President Donald Trump did not follow up on a Russian proposal to extend warhead limits in the agreement for one year.

primary.headline: U.S. drone-makers debut at Singapore Airshow eyeing Asia sales amid China threat
primary.description: The companies believe their early battlefield experience and initial Pentagon backing prove they can deliver the systems needed ‌as China builds its presence in the region.

primary.headline: Rising star Aonishiki shows poise beyond years both in and out the sumo ring
primary.description: Record-breaking success and incredible assimilation have both been made possible by the young Ukrainian’s diligence, maturity and strong willpower.

primary.headline: Countries using internet blackouts to boost censorship, privacy firm warns
primary.description: Governments in countries like Iran and Myanmar are emerging from internet shutdowns with a supercharged ability to censor internet access.

primary.headline: Israeli Ambassador to Japan Speaks about Japan’s Role in the Reconstruction of Gaza
primary.description: Israeli Ambassador to Japan Gilad Cohen spoke about Japan’s expected role in the reconstruction of war-ravaged Gaza, during an interview with The Japan News in Tokyo.

primary.headline: Japan’s Govt Sets Goal for World’s No. 3 in Number of Highly Cited Science Papers by 2035, Up from 13th in Recent Years
primary.description: The government is considering setting a target for Japan to rank third globally in the share of the top 10% most-cited papers in 2035, according to a draft of its basic plan on science and technology

TEPCO to Reactivate Nuclear Reactor at Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Power Plant As Early As Monday
Japan’s Ginkakuji Temple to Increase Admission Fees for 1st Time in 32 Years from April
primary.description: KYOTO — Admission fees to Ginkakuji temple, a World Heritage Site, will increase from April for the first time in 32 years, the temple announced last month.

primary.headline: Sumo Scene / Sumo Matches Watched by Japan’s Emperor for 1st Time in 6 Years
primary.description: During last month’s New Year Grand Sumo Tournament, which came to a feverish conclusion, one hot topic was the return of “tenran-zumo,” the term used when the Emperor attends the day’s matches.

primary.headline: TMSC to Produce 3-Nanometer Semiconductors in Japan’s Kumamoto Pref.; Takaichi Pledges Support in Meeting with Executives
primary.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) told the Japanese government on Thursday about its plan to mass-produce 3-nanometer semiconductors in Kumamoto Prefecture.

primary.headline: Travel Across PokéPark KANTO, Searching Far and Wide for Your Favorite Pokémon
primary.description: There are over 600 individual Pokémon at PokéPark KANTO including Psyduck grasping its head, Farfetch’d fighting with Murkrow and Litten hanging out on a roof. You gotta catch ’em all.

primary.headline: Australian Woman Died of Asphyxiation in Nagano Ski Lift Accident; Victim Is Believed to Have Been Pulled Along by Backpack Chest Strap
primary.description: The cause of death for the woman who became suspended from a ski lift at Tsugaike Mountain Resort in Otari, Nagano Prefecture, was hypoxic encephalopathy due to asphyxiation, prefectural police announ

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
I visited Kagoshima City, Kagoshima Prefecture with the support of Takuma Miyaji, who is officially recognized by the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Takuma Miyaji from everyone in Kagoshima Ward 1 (part of Kagoshima City, Kagoshima District) will be my strength, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Miyaji Takuma”!

We will continue to deliver countermeasures against high prices to Kagoshima Prefecture!

This morning, I met with C.C. Wei, chairman of Taiwanese semiconductor manufacturer TSMC, at the Prime Minister's Office.

At today's meeting, I received a very encouraging report from Chairman Wei.
It was announced that TSMC would change its plans for a second factory in Kumamoto to produce cutting-edge 3-nanometer logic semiconductors and increase the total amount of investment.

With the support of Yasushi Furukawa, who is officially recognized by the Liberal Democratic Party, we visited Shiroishi Town, Kishima District, Saga Prefecture.
The support for Yasushi Furukawa from everyone in Saga 2 Wards (Karatsu City, Taku City, Imari City, Takeo City, Kashima City, Ogi City, Ureshino City, Higashimatsuura District, Nishimatsuura District, Kishima District, Fujitsu District) will be the strength of me, Sanae Takaichi.

Today, before leaving for Kyushu, I cast an absentee ballot (voting from a location other than where my resident card is located) at a ward office in Tokyo. 

We would like to express our gratitude to all the local governments who are carrying out election affairs.
We especially apologize to those in snowy countries who have to make the difficult journey to the voting booth in poor footing.

I, Sanae Takaichi, have a final request.
The Liberal Democratic Party candidates in your area are people I personally endorsed.
Making the Japanese archipelago strong and prosperous.
In order to make our policies a reality, please entrust your important vote to the LDP-approved candidate in your area.
Your vote will give you confidence in the Takaichi administration.
